body_html:
@peterjc123 Also find a bug while running:

# CUDA TEST
import torch
x = torch.Tensor([1.0])
xx = x.cuda()
print(xx)

# CUDNN TEST
from torch.backends import cudnn
print(cudnn.is_acceptable(xx))

  File "test.py", line 9, in <module>
    print(cudnn.is_acceptable(xx))
  File "C:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn\__init__.py", line 70, in is_acceptable
    if _libcudnn() is None:
  File "C:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn\__init__.py", line 35, in _libcudnn
    lib = find_cudnn_windows_lib()
  File "C:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn\__init__.py", line 23, in find_cudnn_win
    cudnn_lib_name = os.path.basename(out)
NameError: name 'os' is not defined

Checked the code, os is not imported.

After a simple hot fix, the cuddn test returns True.
body_text:
@peterjc123 Also find a bug while running:
# CUDA TEST
import torch
x = torch.Tensor([1.0])
xx = x.cuda()
print(xx)

# CUDNN TEST
from torch.backends import cudnn
print(cudnn.is_acceptable(xx))

  File "test.py", line 9, in <module>
    print(cudnn.is_acceptable(xx))
  File "C:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn\__init__.py", line 70, in is_acceptable
    if _libcudnn() is None:
  File "C:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn\__init__.py", line 35, in _libcudnn
    lib = find_cudnn_windows_lib()
  File "C:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn\__init__.py", line 23, in find_cudnn_win
    cudnn_lib_name = os.path.basename(out)
NameError: name 'os' is not defined

Checked the code, os is not imported.
After a simple hot fix, the cuddn test returns True.
body:
@peterjc123 Also find a bug while running:
```
# CUDA TEST
import torch
x = torch.Tensor([1.0])
xx = x.cuda()
print(xx)

# CUDNN TEST
from torch.backends import cudnn
print(cudnn.is_acceptable(xx))
```

```Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test.py", line 9, in <module>
    print(cudnn.is_acceptable(xx))
  File "C:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn\__init__.py", line 70, in is_acceptable
    if _libcudnn() is None:
  File "C:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn\__init__.py", line 35, in _libcudnn
    lib = find_cudnn_windows_lib()
  File "C:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn\__init__.py", line 23, in find_cudnn_win
    cudnn_lib_name = os.path.basename(out)
NameError: name 'os' is not defined
```
Checked the code, os is not imported.

After a simple hot fix, the cuddn test returns True.
